intro: Gymnadenia conopsea proles alpina, commonly known as the alpine cowberry, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky, or grassy habitats at high altitudes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, oval-shaped berries that are edible. Gymnadenia conopsea proles alpina is adapted to cold climates and has a slow growth rate, making it a rare and specialized species.
